public class RetryerBuilder<V>
extends java.lang.Object

A builder used to configure and create a Retryer.

withWaitStrategy

public RetryerBuilder<V> withWaitStrategy(@Nonnull
                                          WaitStrategy waitStrategy)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Sets the wait strategy used to decide how long to sleep between failed attempts. The default strategy is to retry immediately after a failed attempt.

Parameters:
waitStrategy - the strategy used to sleep between failed attempts
Returns:
this
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a wait strategy has already been set.

withStopStrategy

public RetryerBuilder<V> withStopStrategy(StopStrategy stopStrategy)
Sets the wait strategy used to decide . The default strategy is to not sleep at all between attempts.

Parameters:
stopStrategy - the strategy used to sleep between failed attempts
Returns:
this
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a stop strategy has already been set.

retryIfException

public RetryerBuilder<V> retryIfException()
Configures the retryer to retry if an exception (i.e. any Exception or subclass of Exception) is thrown by the call.

Returns:
this

retryIfRuntimeException

public RetryerBuilder<V> retryIfRuntimeException()
Configures the retryer to retry if a runtime exception (i.e. any RuntimeException or subclass of RuntimeException) is thrown by the call.

Returns:
this

Configures the retryer to retry if an exception of the given class (or subclass of the given class) is thrown by the call.

Parameters:
exceptionClass - the type of the exception which should cause the retryer to retry

                                          com.google.common.base.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> exceptionPredicate)
Configures the retryer to retry if an exception satisfying the given predicate is thrown by the call.

Parameters:
exceptionPredicate - the predicate which causes a retry if satisfied
Returns:
this

                                       com.google.common.base.Predicate<V> resultPredicate)
Configures the retryer to retry if the result satisfies the given predicate.

Parameters:
resultPredicate - a predicate applied to the result, and which causes the retryer to retry if the predicate is satisfied
Returns:
